body: OpenRA needs at least XP SP3 plus .NET 4.0 to be installed.  I'm surprised that this error wasn't caught by the installer.

I do have Service Pack 3.
I'm not sure about .NET framework (learned this term just now) .. I'll try to install some post-4.0 version, if it's not yet in the computer.

The XP was installed in 2012 summer. The computer hardware was bought in 2011, lenovo E420 --- this is not that bad right?

Interesting.
In theory it should work if you install .NET 4.0.

.NET 4.0 installed, many thanks!

However I'm still confused about "how to run"..
![qq 20151227195745](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16450943/12012812/dff92904-acd3-11e5-907a-ab32048f7981.png)

Under {{D:\Program Files\Command & Conquer}} I have many items installed, including C&C95, ra1, ra2, yuri, and OpenRA, in their respective folders. Do I have to copy the files into OpenRA folder? Or are they supposed to be detected by OpenRA? --- why there ain't any hint in the FAQs or any help/readme files .. :/

Something is wrong with the rendering. That dialog should look like this:
![](http://i.imgur.com/DwUv2be.png)
You can try clicking where the buttons should be, or you can read the wiki article to see how to install the assets manually.

Edit: You should probably just join us on IRC ( http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=openra ).

Here are the two logs of interest. I have renamed them as .txt files.
The Chinese character 在 means "at / in".

[exception.txt](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/72895/exception.txt)
[graphics.txt](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/72896/graphics.txt)
